rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Anything in a fictional universe that can act autonomously and thus perform actions. This type covers fictional characters and fictional organizations.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Agent

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an agent in a fictional universe to a character in the same universe to which the agent is "friendly" or has sworn an allegiance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Allied Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an agent in a fictional universe to an organization in the same universe to which the agent is "friendly" or has sworn an allegiance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Allied Organization

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an agent in a fictional universe to another agent in the same universe to which the first agent is "friendly" or has sworn an allegiance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Allies

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates an agent in a fictional universe to the religion with which the agent is affiliated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Religion

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all fictional calendar systems. These are the system of time measurement used in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Calendar System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a calendar system to a descriptor that indicates whether dates in this system count forward (i.e. as the numbers increase, the dates go farther into the future) or backward (i.e. as the numbers increase, the dates go farther into the past, similar to BCE dates in the Gregorian calendar).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Directionality

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional calendar system to another calendar system that predates it.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Preceded by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: If this calendar system is succeeded or superseded by another system, enter the succeeding calendar system here.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Replaced with

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional universe in which this system is used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Used in fictional universes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains descriptor that indicate whether a calendar system counts forward (i.e. as the numbers increase, the dates go farther into the future) or backward (i.e. as the numbers increase, the dates go farther into the past, similar to BCE dates in the Gregorian calendar).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Calendar System Directionality

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a descriptor for calendar system directionality, viz. forward to backward, to a calendar system that has this directionality.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Calendars

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all characters found in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to the age of the character on a given date.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Age

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the character's allies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Allies

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Character alter ego
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Alter ego

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to a character that he or she assumes in some cases. There are many instances of this property in the domain of comic books, e.g. Superman/Clark Kent and Batman/Bruce Wayne. Note that this property is symmetric, so if x is the alter ego of y, then y is the alter ego of x.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Alter Ego Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to a fictional universe in which the character appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: appears_in_these_fictional_universes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the mso:media_common.creative_work the character appears in.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appears in Work

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to a real person that is the basis for the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Based on

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to another fictional character that is the inspiration for the first one. For example, the character Sherlock Holmes in the novel "The Seven-per-cent Solution" is based on the character of the same name in the short stories by Arthur Conan Doyle.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Based on Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to information about a skill and the level of proficiency at which the skill is exercised.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Competency

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to the gender of the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gender

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to a standard descriptor of what the character does for a living.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Occupation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Used mainly for fantasy, science fiction, and super-hero fiction, this property specifies powers or abilities possessed by the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Powers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to a rank held by the character. This property can be used for military and para-military ranks, as well as ranks of nobility, chivalry, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The species of the character. Used primarily in fantasy and science fiction, but also for non-human characters (such as Lassie). It is not necessary to enter \"human\" for every character in a realistic work of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Species

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Used mainly for fantasy, science fiction, and super-hero fiction, this property specifies powers or abilities that are lacking in the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Weaknesses

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to a child of the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Children

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to the real person who created the character, e.g. in a novel written by the person.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Creator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to the character's date of birth. This property is multi-valued, so that multiple dates can be recorded in various calendar systems.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date of Birth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether or not the fictional character is deceased.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Deceased

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to a school attended by the character in the relevant fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Education

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to employment information about the character in the relevant fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Employers

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the character's enemies.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Enemies

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to the ethnicity of the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ethnicity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to the ethnicity that the character has in the fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ethnicity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the character's date of first appearance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: First Appearance Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to an object owned by the character in the relevant fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Has Possessed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to the height of the character, in meters, when he or she was tallest.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Height

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the character's date of last appearance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Last Appearance Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to information about the marriage(s) of the character in the relevant fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Marriage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional character to a medical condition that the character has or had.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical conditions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the character's military service.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Service

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the character's mso:fictional_universe.nationality
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Nationality

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to an organization to which the character belongs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Organizations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to a parent of the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Parents

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to a location where the character is said to have been born.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Place of Birth

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to a location where the character lived. For example, Sherlock Holmes lived at 221-B Baker Street in London, and Bilbo Baggins lived at Bag's End.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Places Lived

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to a quotation of the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Quotations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to the mso:fictional_universe.kinship_relationship, collecting data on the kinships for the character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Relatives

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to information about the love affairs of the character in the relevant fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Romantically Involved with

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional character to another fictional character that is a sibling in the given fictional universe. Note that the expected type of this property should eventually be changed to fictional_universe.character.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Siblings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character to a description of the character's weapons.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Weapons

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe character to the weight of the character, in kilograms, when the character was fully developed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Weight
Fictional Character Creator
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: There is no need for this primary entity. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\jcoop] Successor:[mso:people.person]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data for a fictional character's military service.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Military Service Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character_military_service to the rank of the fictional character for the given time period.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.character_military_service to the military unit the character served in.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Unit

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all occupations used in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Occupation

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all fictional character powers.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Power

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether the power or ability of the character is concealed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Hidden

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all ranks used in fictional works. This rank includes military rank as well as some social ranks.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Rank

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all species used in fictional settings.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character Species

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: For fictional species, the fictional universe(s) that this species is found in. This will primarily apply to science-fiction and fantasy universes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Found in fictional universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing fictional characters that are intended to be more like animals than humans.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Creature

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that is used to represent dates and times in calendar systems that are created for fictional universes.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Date/Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the non-Gregorian calendar system of the fictional work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Calendar System

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the given date in the Gregorian calendar. Note that this property should be used only if the work of fiction uses the Gregorian calendar (e.g. for fictional works set in the real world).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date/Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the date or time in the given non-Gregorian calendar system.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Other Date/Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the work of fiction in which the date/time is featured.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Portrayed In

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing organizations and people that hire workers for a job.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Employer in Fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional employer to information about the fictional characters employed
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Employees

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the employment of characters in works of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Employment Tenure

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the fictional character employed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Employee

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the employer of the fictional character. Note that this can be either a wholly fictional employer or a real-world employer that has been used fictitiously.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Employer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the end date of a fictional employment tenure.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the job title of the fictional character when he or she worked for the given employer.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Title

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the start date of a fictional employment tenure.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start Date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A group of individuals in a fictional universe that share common characteristics, such as ancestry, country of origin, language, religion, culture, and/or physical appearance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ethnicity

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing groupings of people based on culture or race that is used in a work of fiction or that is used fictitiously.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Ethnicity in Fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type whose instances occur in a work of fiction and are characterized by a transient existence, e.g. happenings, processes, actions, celebrations, ticketed events, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Event in Fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date this event ended (in this fictional context). (The date can be entered in the Gregorian or fictional calendar systems.) This property is non-unique so that multiple dates can be recorded in compatible calendar systems and so that events which appear in multiple, unrelated works, can have different dates if necessary.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: End date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional (or fictionalized) part of an event to the overall event. An example is a war and a battle that is part of the war.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Included by these Events

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional (or fictionalized) event that occurs to a part of the event. An example is a battle that is part of a war.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Includes Events

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional setting (which can also be a real place) in which this event occurs.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Setting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date this event began (in this fictional context). (The date can be entered in the Gregorian or fictional calendar systems.) This property is non-unique so that multiple dates can be recorded in compatible calendar systems and so that events which appear in multiple, unrelated works, can have different dates if necessary.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Start date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a work of fiction that references the event.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appears in these works

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing classifications of workers by similar duties and characteristics.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Job Title

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional job title (or a job title used fictitiously) to information about the employment of a fictional character who has or had the title.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Characters with this Job

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type collecting the data on a kinship between two fictional characters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Kinship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.kinship_relationship to the kinship relationship the subject entity has in relation to the object entity.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Kinship

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.kinship_relationship to the object of the kinship relation. The type of kinship, in most cases, is dependent on the character in the subject of the relationship. For example, if 'Simba' is the subject of the relation and 'Scar' is the object, then 'Uncle' is the type of kinship. Conversely, if 'Scar' is the subject and 'Simba' the object, then the type of kinship is 'Nephew'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Object

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating an mso:fictional_universe.kinship_relationship to the subject of the kinship relation. The type of kinship, in most cases, is dependent on the character in the subject of the relationship. For example, if 'Simba' is the subject of the relation and 'Scar' is the object, then 'Uncle' is the type of kinship. Conversely, if 'Scar' is the subject and 'Simba' the object, then the type of kinship is 'Nephew'.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Subject

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all languages used in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Language in fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Fictional species that typically use this language.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spoken by character species

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional universe or universes in which this language is used.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Found in fictional universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Fictional locations in which this language is commonly spoken.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spoken in fictional settings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the marriages of characters in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Marriage of Fictional Characters

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a fictional character who participated in the given marriage.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Spouse

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all medical conditions used in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Medical condition in fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a medical condition in a fictional work with a character in the work who has the condition.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Characters with this Condition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the collection of all fictional military organizations.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Military Organization

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all objects used in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Object

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Special aspects of the object like Magical Powers, Curse of Ugliness, Invisible, Travels In Time Backwards, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Attributes/Properties

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional character who is said to have created this object.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Created By

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date this object was created. (The date can be entered in the Gregorian or fictional calendar systems.) This property is non-unique so that multiple dates can be recorded in compatible calendar systems.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Creation date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: DEPRECATED
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Created

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: DEPRECATED
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Date Destroyed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: This property has been deprecated.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Destroyed By

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The date, if any, this object was destroyed. (The date can be entered in the Gregorian or fictional calendar systems.) This property is non-unique so that multiple dates can be recorded in compatible calendar systems.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Destruction date

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The character or characters that destroyed this object.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Object Destroyer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The method of the object's destruction, e.g. chariot wreck
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Destruction Method

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional object to a character who has had possession of the object at one time or another.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Owner

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A location (real or fictional) where the object was or is located, according to a fictional work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Setting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional object to the composition or stuff out of which the fictional object is made.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Substance

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional universe or universes that this object appears in.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Universe
Fictional Object Destroyer
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: It's not clear what the intended meaning of this type is. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:fictional_universe.character]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: fictional_objects_destroyed
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. If this property is needed, it can be added to fictional_universe.character. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for means of destroying something in a work of fiction, e.g. "drop it into a volcano beneath the sea".
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Object Destruction Method

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a fictional object destruction method with an object that was destroyed using this method.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Objects Destroyed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all organizations in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Organization in fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a fictional organization to the founder of the fictional organization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Organization Founder

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a fictional organization to a character that is a member of the organization in a work of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Members

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The organization in fiction that is considered the parent or controlling fictional organization
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Parent Organization in fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional organization to a fictional suborganization.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Suborganization in Fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional organization to a standard descriptor for fictional organizations.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type of Organization

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional universe or universes this organization appears in. This will apply primarily to wholly fictional organizations.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appears in universes
fictional_organizations_founded
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: The type of this property has been deprecated. If this property is needed, it can be added to fictional_universe.character. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for kinds of organizations that appear in fictional works, e.g. Sorcerer's School.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Organization Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Fictional organizations (or real organizations that appear in works of fiction) of this kind.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Organizations
Person Or Being In Fiction
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: From what I can gather, this type is supposed to represent fictional characters that are based on real historical figures. Accordingly, the type mso:fictional_universe.character should be used instead. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:fictional_universe.character]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all plants in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Plant

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a plant to a fictional universe in which the plant appears.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Featured in Fictional Universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Type representing the set of all pok??mon characters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pok??mon Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a Pok??mon character its evolution(s).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Evolution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a pok??mon character to its gender ratios.
The relationship type containing data on a Pok??mon character's evolution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pok??mon Evolution

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a Pok??mon evolution to the conditions that need to be met before the evolution can happen.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Condition

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating the evolution relationship to its type, for example, first evolution, second evolution, and so on.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Evolution Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a Pok??mon character's evolution to the character at the end of its evolution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Evolved Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating a Pok??mon character evolution to the character at the start of its evolution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Evolving Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Relationship type that contains the gender and percentages for Pok??mon characters.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pok??mon Gender

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property to relate the gender relationship to the gender.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gender

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Property relating the gender relationship to the percentage of the given gender.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Percentage

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A set of beliefs or a cultural system in a fictional universe that is concerned with explaining the forces controlling human destiny.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Religion

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the love affairs of characters in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Romantic Involvement

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies a fictional character who participated in the given love affair.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Partner

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all schools in fictional works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: School in fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Fictional characters who are said to have attended this educational institution.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Students/graduates

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all setting found in fictional works. Settings are the time and place in which the specific storyline occurs. See also mso:fictional_universe.universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Setting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional setting to another fictional setting that contains it. For example, in "1984", the primary setting of "Airstrip One" is contained by the country "Oceania". For another example, in "Gulliver's Travels," the fictional island of Lilliput is contained by the Indian Ocean.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contained by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional setting to another fictional setting that it contains. For example, in "1984", the primary setting of "Airstrip One" is contained by the country "Oceania". For another example, in "Gulliver's Travels," the fictional island of Lilliput is contained by the Indian Ocean.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Contains

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional setting to an event that happens in the setting in a work of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Events

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional setting to a character that was born in the setting in a work of fiction.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Characters Born Here

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional setting to a fictional language that is used in the setting.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Languages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a setting to a standard descriptor for the kind of setting, e.g. a country, city, planet, island, etc.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Setting Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional setting to the fictional universe of the setting.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional setting to a fictional work that includes the setting.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Works Set Here
Sibling Relationship (of Fictional Characters)
rdf:Description.mso:type.type.deprecation_info: This type is not necessary. A fictional character can be directly connected to his/her siblings by the property fictional_universe.character.siblings. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:fictional_universe.character.siblings]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Siblings
rdf:Description.mso:type.property.deprecation_info: A fictional character can be connected to his or her siblings directly via the property fictional_universe.character.siblings. DeprecatedBy:[REDMOND\ianiles] Successor:[mso:fictional_universe.character.siblings]

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all substances found in fictional works, e.g. Orichalcum. Note that fictional_universe.object should be used for individuated fictional things.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Material in fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional substance to the color of the substance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Color

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional substance to a fictional object that is (partially) made up of the substance.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Object

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: The fictional universe (or universes) that this substance appears in.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Appears in Fictional Universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains standard descriptors for kinds of fictional settings, e.g. city-state or capital city.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Type of Fictional Setting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a standard descriptor for a fictional setting to a setting that exemplifies this descriptor.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Settings

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all fictional universes. These are the self-consistent fictional settings that make up the setting or set of settings for fictional works. A fictional_universe.setting is associated with one work, whereas a fictional_universe.universe is larger in scope and is usually for a series or set of works.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional universe to a calendar system used in the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Calendar Systems

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe to a character that appears in the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Character

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe to the person, people, or organization that created the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Created by

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional universe to a fictional object that appears in the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Objects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional universe to a fictional language that appears in the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Languages

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe to a literary series that is set in the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Literary Series

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional universe to a fictional organization that is part of the universe, e.g. Knights of Neraka.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Organizations

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe to a setting of the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Setting

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional universe to a fictional species that appears in the universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Species

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a fictional universe to a fictional work, of any media, that is set in this universe (e.g., books, films, tv programs, video games, comics...).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Works Set Here

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A person, company or organization that is responsible for creating a fictional universe.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Universe Creator

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that relates a fictional universe creator to one of the universes that he or she created.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Universes Created

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all fictional works: books, movies, and TV shows.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Work of Fiction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a work of fiction to an event that is represented in the work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Events

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a work of fiction to a fictional universe that is represented in the work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Fictional Universe

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a work of fiction to a place, real or imaginary, that appears in the work.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Setting
